page.title: 04A rural museum in Breamore 1
page.content: The{Countryside Museum,}one of the leading rural museums in the country,boasts an extensive and expanding collection of farming tools machinery and rural crafts.The exhibits trace the history of farming and village life in this area over the past 150 years. Agricultural implements on display include such varied items as bulls' blinkers(affectionately known as Boadicea's bra!),giant hay forks used in water meadows,sickles and scythes of all varieties and a lethal collection of man and boy traps, designed to put the poacher of yesteryear firmly out of business. The{Transport}and{Power}section houses a large and most impressive collection of steam engines, tractors and other farm machinery.Another part of the museum is devoted to a display of
